html: Without the help of proxy saviors, the belated repenters of Jehovah’s people yet suffer the aftermath of their former actions. Cut off from Jehovah’s presence, they are made to realize that without him there is no access to any other saving power (Isaiah 43:11). Their only recourse is to complete the entire repentance process until he revives and heals them (Isaiah 57:15-16; cf. 6:10). The hand of Jehovah that might have delivered them, they rejected, so that now they feel his hand of punishment (Isaiah 50:2, 10-11). Although he called them, they still mostly wallow in spiritual inertia (Isaiah 43:22).
